name: Dr Pooky Knightsmith
description: Mental health educator trying to make a ding in the universe | #ActuallyAutistic Mum, Wife, Climber, Tenor | Director @CreativeEdu who finds #3GoodThings daily
tweet:
@CaraLisette I’ve done a few and judged a few - all good tips here. I’d add 
> pick a title that intrigues
>keep it short & simple
>Don’t alienate with language/acronyms
>Have copies people can take 
>take the chance to talk to people, be enthusiastic (and talk to them about theirs too)

name: Dr Pooky Knightsmith
description: Mental health educator trying to make a ding in the universe | #ActuallyAutistic Mum, Wife, Climber, Tenor | Director @CreativeEdu who finds #3GoodThings daily
tweet:
In case you’re interested:

Mirtazapine - antidepressant esp good for PTSD + helps me sleep and works at low BMI unlike others

Propanalol - prevents my migraines 

Avomine - reduces acute anxiety but isn’t addictive & doesn’t stop me driving like my old meds (lorazepam)

name: Dr Pooky Knightsmith

tweet:
I keep writing and deleting a tweet about medication

There is so much stigma attached to taking pills for head stuff. But you know what?  I’m doing pretty well and it’s thanks in no small part to these bad boys

There should be no shame in that

2. Have a writing routine & rituals 

3. Schedule breaks and lean into them

You’ve got this.

name: Dr Pooky Knightsmith
description: Mental health educator trying to make a ding in the universe | #ActuallyAutistic Mum, Wife, Climber, Tenor | Director @CreativeEdu who finds #3GoodThings daily
tweet:
@_Sarah_Hughes_ Oh wow. How exciting. My tips:
1. Invest in a good keyboard & mouse
2. Finish each day when you have more still to say (then tomorrow starts easily)
3.Write fast now. Edit later
4.Set a daily goal & a stretch goal 5.Reward yourself
6.Regular breaks. Move/breathe
7.ENJOY!

tweet:
But.. I was soon put in my place by Lyra

Lyra: When does your next book come out?
Me: About 12 months 
Lyra: 12 MONTHS?! you wrote it in a week. Why does it take so long?

<pauses, thinking>

Lyra: is it because they have to fix your spelling?

😂 😂

In case you didn't know... 

PPIE = Patient and Public Involvement and Engagement 

Which basically means involving the people who'll be impacted by a research or a service in its development

We no longer recommend snapping of elastic bands and other proxy measures for self-harm

name: Dr Pooky Knightsmith
description: Mental health educator trying to make a ding in the universe | #ActuallyAutistic Mum, Wife, Climber, Tenor | Director @CreativeEdu who finds #3GoodThings daily
tweet:
@CaraLisette A poem I wrote many years ago that haunts me... 

It’ll kill you.
They told me.
I couldn’t care less.
The thing that I knew,
But I could not confess,
Was that unless it killed me,
Then I’d always know,
That there’d been,
Just a little bit,
Further
To Go.

description: Mental health educator trying to make a ding in the universe | #ActuallyAutistic Mum, Wife, Climber, Tenor | Director @CreativeEdu who finds #3GoodThings daily
tweet:
@HARRIETF74 A few things but mainly learning to live well with with autism. This one is autistic burnout without a doubt

Also daily propanalol is preventative for me. Prescribed by a consultant neurologist years ago; if I stop it I get a migraine within a couple of days

name: Dr Pooky Knightsmith
description: Mental health educator trying to make a ding in the universe | #ActuallyAutistic Mum, Wife, Climber, Tenor | Director @CreativeEdu who finds #3GoodThings daily
tweet: @SusanBr99143651 A mixture of stuff to reduce nausea and pain. The propanalol I take daily to prevent then more frequently during. Sleep is the most important medicine though; the minute I throw up and my vision starts to go I head to bed for a day (or two or three) https://t.co/RPbfZKWjZQ

description: Mental health educator trying to make a ding in the universe | #ActuallyAutistic Mum, Wife, Climber, Tenor | Director @CreativeEdu who finds #3GoodThings daily
tweet:
Migraines suck, but I’m grateful that 

a) They no longer dominate my life
b) People are understanding when plans change
c) They make me take stock

When I can see and think straight I’ll book that week of writing & walking I’ve been thinking about

But now... back to bed 😴

Testing students is a quick way for you to assess gaps in their knowledge

tweet:
For any newer followers the context is that I have a history of anorexia and self-harm as well as chronic pain in my feet 

I used to run obsessively. It eased my anxiety but fuelled my anorexia 

Now I climb instead but all the walls are shut and I’m struggling

tweet:

I have a history of being too anxious to leave the house / be around people

I can mostly manage it by constantly making myself go out

I lapse if I stop practicing

Lockdown validates me staying home & adds to the fear of going out

tweet: Some days I wish I could ban all screens always; then I see Lyra teaching herself calligraphy and Ellie perfecting her front flips following online tutorials; or see the girls playing dolls with their friends via teams and I realise there is good here too....

name: Dr Pooky Knightsmith
description: Mental health educator trying to make a ding in the universe | #ActuallyAutistic Mum, Wife, Climber, Tenor | Director @CreativeEdu who finds #3GoodThings daily
tweet: We revisit the rules often and they are all agreed as a family and the kids pull us up if we get it wrong too (you do NOT get your phone out at our dinner table unless you want to see Ellie’s angry face!

name: Dr Pooky Knightsmith
description: Mental health educator trying to make a ding in the universe | #ActuallyAutistic Mum, Wife, Climber, Tenor | Director @CreativeEdu who finds #3GoodThings daily
tweet:
As a family, we currently have a few rules:
1)Screen free Sundays (10-6)
2)Screen limits every day
3)Screens only in communal spaces 
4)If in doubt, ask us - we will always help and never be angry so long as you ask for help
5)Long list of banned sites / SM

name: Dr Pooky Knightsmith
description: Mental health educator trying to make a ding in the universe | #ActuallyAutistic Mum, Wife, Climber, Tenor | Director @CreativeEdu who finds #3GoodThings daily
tweet: Like many families, We have had to compromise a lot on our boundaries re online tech since March - but these conversations help keep us in the right track

description: Mental health educator trying to make a ding in the universe | #ActuallyAutistic Mum, Wife, Climber, Tenor | Director @CreativeEdu who finds #3GoodThings daily
tweet:

Granny, Tom, the girls and I watched this together today. It started some great conversations and helped the girls realise we’re not just being ‘so unfair’ when we put certain boundaries in place. Would recommend

I remember when I handed mine in (you had to hand it in physically back then, it involved a 3 hour round trip for me) I expected a fanfare and streamers.  

I got a receipt... 😂
